content:
so, this stable release breaks a bunch of analysis in rustc versions prior to 1.52 (see: https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/10851 + https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/10868)

I was wondering if we should state the minimum supported rustc version somewhere, and have r-a warn in the IDE when your rustc toolchain is too old for rust-analyzer to use.

A warning might be a good idea ye, though to be fair, I don't think we always know the last stable version we properly support? As we technically only try to support the last stable version I think? :sweat_smile:
at the very least, we can bump the version when we become aware that we've broken analysis on older rustc.
